name: The Devonshire Arms Country House Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent 2 delightful nights at this lovely old style hotel. The building may be old but the facilities are bang up to date, with a very comfortable bedroom & modern bathroom in the Wharfedale Wing. Our package included breakfast & a 3 course meal in the Brasserie. The food was very good, with an imaginative menu for the evening meal & everything you would expect & more for breakfast. The staff were all very pleasant & helpful. A very big plus was the use of the spa area across the road which included a gym, swimming pool, spa pool, sauna & steam room. It was a lovely end to a cold day walking on the fells. Bolton Abbey is very close by with it's acres of countryside & river that can be explored. A return will certainly be in the offing I'm sure.
reviews.title: Devonshire Delight
Faultless...
reviews.text: Stayed here this week. The hotel is in the most beautiful location with lovely walks straight out of the door. With roaring fires in the lounges to welcome you, a sublime afternoon tea to while away an hour or two and a simply gorgeous bedroom - The Photographers Room - to retreat to, this all added up to a wonderful stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bedroom was immaculate witha sitting area, lovely views over the gardens, and an enormous bathroom, sadly the tv at the end of the bath was not working but this didnt bother me at all.
reviews.title: Extremely disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner in the Brasserie was very good, although the room was extemely hot, the food was excellent and wine list reasonable.
reviews.title: A Country Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was served in the restaurant and had a very good choice and was delicious.
reviews.title: Last minute break after cancellation due to snow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked for a quick night away (mainly so we could use the spa facilities and let someone else cook us dinner on our day off), it's not that far from our home (1/2 hour away so it was considered a little treat). We were offered a discounted rate for dinner bed and breakfast because we were booking late availability. For £243 we expected a little more than an offering of fish and chips or sausage and mash and a very small room.... I absolutely kid you not, we were completely appaulled. Service charges on everything from a cup of tea in the bar to your room rate. breakfast was shambolic with everything from the drinks to the breakfast we ordered being incorrect and the place almostly completely run by staff who could barely speak English. I own a country inn and restaurant and always try to see the "commercial" side of service and stays but this place is just coasting on a reputation it really doesn't deserve; certainly not in our experience. It is geared to large weddings and conferences only and indivisual guests paying way over the odds for their facilities is a by-product. The spa is clean but don't go between 3pm-6pm when it is full of babies in the very small pool. What in heavens name is the place thinking with prices such as this and not offering a tiny bit of value for money and better service for ordinary paying guests, even at these price levels? My total bill came to just under £500 for one night (that was with one treatment each in the spa).
reviews.title: Overpriced...dreadful, never again

likes.disliked: — being ripped off for everything else from the room rate to extra service charges and the crap dinner menu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We cannot complain to establishments at the time because it looks like we are being silly as we also own guest accommodation, so it can leave a bitter taste if you get bad all round service and value. I will never go here again and certainly not recommend it to any of my friends and guests.
reviews.title: Pretentious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at this hotel at the end of May. The room was extremely small for the high rate of 220 per night and we found the 12.5% added to everything from a cup of tea to a glass of water to be exorbitant. Two weddings were held in the hotel on the two nights we stayed and it was extremely difficult after dinner to even find a chair to sit on in the lounge area. We ate in the formal stuffy restaurant and also in the brasserie which did not impress us either.
reviews.title: Condescendingly-awful-hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side there are beautiful walks to be had from the hotel but would I stay here again - no - very bad value for money.
reviews.title: Lady Cavandish's Shadow

likes.liked: — Hotel full of antiques from Chatsworth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rude, haughty staff. Smelly dogs allowed in the bar area. Full of pretentious locals. Would not recommened.
reviews.title: Over-priced

likes.disliked: — price, value, room, water pressure, decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 1 night as part of a brief tour of the North. we chose here because of A) their Michelin Star Restaurant, The Burlington (which I will cover under a separate review) and B) the quality of the establishment and C) their acceptance of dogs.
reviews.title: Unabashed luxury with top notch service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am delighted to say that they scored 5 stars on every aspect!
reviews.title: Wonderful wedding Reception
Lovely setting in beautiful surroundings
reviews.text: Firstly on arrival we were greeted by a charming young man who whisked us through reception to our room in the Wharfedale Wing. Whilst this wing is a fairly modern addition you couldn't really tell as the decor was nicely blended in with the older parts. The room itself was pleasant and airy and of a reasonable size, we had a lovely view across to the hills towards Bolton Abbey. A very nice touch in the room was the excellent tea tray with plenty of teas and a teapot, no little cartons of milk here, just dial '0' and a flask of milk is delivered in seconds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was small but perfectly formed with good quality fittings a good bath and shower with plentiful hot water.
reviews.title: superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: As for the rest of the hotel, dogs are allowed everywhere apart from the restaurants and they are in fact positively welcomed. The lounges (3 of them) are all very pleasant with lots of staff available any time you require anything. In the afternoon we decided to be decadent and have cocktails which I'm pleased to say were beautifully mixed!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel - amazing food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room accomodation was poor and the bathroom antiquated, the shower had a broken control spline. The worst room we have stayed in for the price in the UK or Europe.
reviews.title: The Devonshire Arms Bolton Abbey - Eat but do not stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service in the Brasserie restaurant was poor with no bread provided and an error in the wine billing.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main restaurant, the Burlington was superb, and the wine waiter Nigel went out of his way to be helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful...or not?
Absolutely Fantastic- What a Treat!!!
reviews.text: The management failed to respond to our first E-mail of concern and required written prompting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary, eat in the Burlington and avoid the rest of the hotel.
reviews.title: Cosy pre christmas treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed two nights in April. The hotel is very comfortable and the location is stunning - a morning stroll out of the door and along the river to Bolton Abbey is almost worth the price in itself.
reviews.title: Very nice but a bit overpriced
Beautiful hotel in a great location
reviews.text: But ... £275 per night is a high price, frankly, for a nice comfortable but not especially spacious room, with a bathroom that allows no swinging of cats at all and indeed a bath/shower that you have walk round the toilet bowl to access. And the bed gave my wife backache.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers an excellent breakfast and we found the staff to be (with only one exception) very attentive and helpful. It's all a bit twee though - the English solicitor class clearly loves the place, with a cocktail lounge and all, where you pay over the odds for the drinks and are likely to be surrounded by hooray-Henrys in the evening (not the hotel's fault, of course).
reviews.title: Great hotel, poor spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is well appointed, though, and we enjoyed meals in both the Brasserie and the Burlington. Neither are cheap but the quality was good (see separate review for The Burlington).
reviews.title: loving it.. again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd give this place 3.5 stars if I could. But if it's 4 or 3, I'll go with three because of that room-rate. That's New York prices. They get away with it because of the location. We liked it. Maybe you'll love it.
reviews.title: The food alone is well worth the trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed over a couple of days, me to go out and about to take photographs while my wife relaxed in the Spa area.
reviews.title: Not deserving of SLH status

likes.disliked: — Variable service, ranging from apalling to SLH level.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: Unfortunately the Spa was fully booked and the swimming pool which looks almost Olympic size on the web site turned out to be considerably smaller.
reviews.title: Reasonable value for money given level of service and quality of amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: Our first meal was in the Brasserie and that's where the poor service first manifested itself. One excuse given was that the Brasserie was busy! I refused to pay their 'discretional' service charge.
reviews.title: Fast fading grandeur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Michelin starred restaurant produced, in my opinion, very variable food. My starter (tuna) was very nice but overly 'fussy' and my licquorice chocolate dessert was to die for. However my wife's starter was inedible. Every dish in accompanied by some 'foam'!
reviews.title: Great wedding venue, hotel lacking for high price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the very high cost of the rooms (even allowing for the AmEx discounts) the hotel still insist on charging for wireless internet access. I blacklist all hotels that do this.
reviews.title: A very good hotel but......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed here as a treat for my husbands birthday. This was our second stay and just as enjoyable as the first. The staff were very attentive and we were given an upgrade for the occassion, with a four poster bed. We had a relaxing drink in thebar and then dined in the brasserie. The food was very good (recommend the rib eye steak) and again the staff were efficient. The hotel is very comfortable and cosy with different small lounges and fires.
reviews.title: Birthday Treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing that let it down was the spa facilities with a small pool and basic steam room and sauna.
reviews.title: Overnight treat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We would love to be able to afford to go more often.
reviews.title: 2 night stop off on the way home from Scotland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WE spent a very relaxing 24 hours at The Devonshire Arms, the bedroom was furnished very well and I enjoyed drinking tea from the china cups and saucers , the bathroom had everything in it but was on the small side. The spa was delightful but only a shame it was across the road from the hotel so you had to take everything you needed with you as it was not convenient to go back to your room if you had forgotten something.
reviews.title: A hotel dear to us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the Brasserie was very nice and the decor in the bar area was particularly bright and uplifting. The breakfast in the fine dining restaurant was unfortunately a let down for us, our order was mixed up and we had to wait a long time for it to come, then my husbands yorkshire breakfast was cold so had to be sent back. we drank tea for the first part of our breakfast then asked for coffee, but again the wrong order came and when the pot eventually came we were not offered clean cups. This is only a minor moan but it should not happen in a hotel of such great standing. I booked a package for this treat, but beware the extra service charge that is put on the final bill it is optional of course, but I do feel that having paid a booking fee in the first place we should not be asked for this extra charge.
reviews.title: Excellent as ever
Snooty Staff who do they think they are!
reviews.text: We attended a wedding reception here, we had high expectations as the hotel has a great reputation. I work in the service industry and spend a lot of my time staying in 5 start hotels around the world so know very well what to expect from such an establishment. My son wanted another orange juice and we were curtly told that we had to go to the bar and pay an extortianate price for one even though the man we asked had a whole jug of it. I do understand that the catering is budgeted but when a 3 year old asks for a bit more this is the time to bend the rules!!! Also one of the hors d'ovres was foie gras, living in France we know what it should taste like this was definaltely not quality. Like other comments we have read the staff are very snooty and treated wedding reception guests like they were 2nd class guests. We were so pleased we chose to stay at a fantastic b&b called Andras farm in Appetreewick which was simply great.

reviews.title: Great English Country retreat
reviews.text: We stayed at the Devonshire Arms earlier this year and had an extraordinary experience starting with the chilled champagne and hand-written welcome note that we found upon check-in at our room. The room itself was spacious and tastefully decorated. The hard-carved canopy bed was as comfortable as it was beautiful and the tea set with the emblem of the Duke and Duchess was a nice touch. The staff was extremely attentive and friendly and I enjoyed every course of our meal at the Burlington and especially the last course served in the lounge where we could sink into oversized chairs and enjoy coffee and petit fours. Coming from New York City, I especially enjoyed the English country ambiance of being able to look through our window and see a herd of sheep milling about or watching a rooster cross the tennis courts. I also loved lounging in the room with the big fireplace and the collection of green wellies by the door for guests to use. It certainly wasn’t a cheap stay given the current exchange rate, but it was a memorable experience and I have been recommending it to all of my friends and family should they decide to jump the pond.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its all change at the Devonshire since the last visit.A new Duke and Duchess, the Managing Director has moved to the Grand in Brighton and the effervescent and highly personable manager Eammon has returned to his native land accross the Irish sea.
reviews.title: The jury is out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: On the experience of this visit the new team are struggling badly.
reviews.title: Out of this world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It would appear that the new MD is still mainly at his old job and is managing via the p&l account on a one day a week basis.All the nice little touches that made the hotel special have disappeared (fruit bowl, sherry,welcome letter, pet packs for guests with dogs, toiletries) and whilst some of the old team remain and are trying hard the atmoshere has been destoyed.
reviews.title: Gastronomic nightmare!

likes.disliked: — Overpriced especially considering the appalling cuisine

aka: The Devonshire Arms Country House Hotel And Spa
description: Situated on the Duke of Devonshire's 30,000 acre Bolton Abbey Estate in the Yorkshire Dales, The Devonshire Arms Country House Hotel and Spa offers 40 individually designed bedrooms, the relaxing Devonshire Health Spa and extensive conference and banqueting facilities. The refined Burlington restaurant with a Michelin Star and 4 AA rosettes is the highest rated in Yorkshire, while the Devonshire Brasserie and Bar is lively and colourful, perfect for a relaxing lunch or informal dinner.
